subject: Evil Little Bill Speaks
event:
Bill Belichick had a press conference this morning to discuss the deflated footballs in the AFC Championship Game, and the accusations that the Patriots were cheating.

For those who missed it,  the highlights:

<lj-embed id="537" />

... with the lack of coverage on the playoffs, but then I realized that vengeance is a dish best served cold.

Evil Little Bill is going to get a slap on the wrist and the NFL is not gonna do anything controversial, especially with Goodell at the helm and Kraft owning the Patriots.

Still, mutatis mutandis, Belicheat's reaction is like Nixon saying he is not a crook. Or Lord Manderly denying he knew anything about Frey pies.

I'm just hoping that someone did mess with the footballs.

comments.article: On the same subject, have you seen this version of fantasy football? :->
I loved how Belichick threw Brady under the bus haha. So if he's Tywin then is Brady supposed to be Jamie or Tyrion..?

I'm a Pats homer, let's start with that. But I don't think Belichick was involved. He was too clear with his denials -- he's not the type to say "I haven't talked about this topic with any players or coaches in 40 years" because there are disgruntled ex-Pats employees out there -- paging Mr. Mangini -- more than willing to spill dirt if he's lying. I just don't think this is an issue the head coach worries about.

I found Brady's press conference much less convincing.
comments.subject: I'd genuinely don't think Belichick was involved

comments.article:
Mr. Martin:

I came across this article on NPR and immediately thought about your points about the Jets firing Rex Ryan.

http://www.npr.org/2015/01/23/379282762/why-nfl-teams-should-reconsider-giving-coaches-the-heave-ho?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=researchnews
comments.subject: You were right about Jets and Rex Ryan

comments.article:
OMG!

Is this a clue?
Is Sgt. Schultz really Jon Snow's dad?
The mind is blown!



Can't Evil Little Bill get in trouble for just repeating what is essentially the same crime?
I guess you know you're old when you don't even have to click on it to know what it is... that's hilarious. :-)

Let me make is 100 percent clear: I HATE The Patriots. I hate them more than I hate my sister-in-law and if you knew her, you'd be shocked. And there is no doubt in my mind that they cheated. They have had to pay money in the past because they have been caught cheating.

My question is this: why didn't the refs notice a difference in the ball?? And trust me, me and a couple of friends tried different PSI. There is no mistaking what a couple of PSI makes. So to me, the refs "dropped the ball".

It hurts for this 49ers fan to say this, but go Seattle.

Sadly, our culture is quick to condemn. Granted, I am biased as a Pats fan, and there was a couple day stretch where I thought they did it, until the information became a bit clearer.

First of all, the initial report of a 2 psi difference was exaggerated. It was closer to 1 psi. Second, the weather conditions can very easily(and in fact they MUST) affect the air pressure inside the balls. Those particular conditions would drop the psi from between .7 and 1.5 psi! Thirdly, when Brady says he couldn't tell the difference, you can tell the difference between a 12.5 psi and an 11.5 psi ball... when you have them both in a hand at the same time and those hands are dry and warm. However, I doubt most people would notice a difference and if they did on a subconscious level they would probably attribute it to the fact that their hands are numb.

The reality is that the actual EVIDENCE does not show the Pats did anything wrong. Do I know for a fact, no, but I still demand proof beyond reasonable doubt. Science gives us reasonable doubt.
comments.subject: Innocent until proven guilty?

comments.article:
No, actually, it doesn't.

Melissa Harris-Perry had a physicist on this morning, and he pretty well dismissed Belichick's "science." The central point being that physics is not random. If it was the weather that did this, it would have affected all the balls, not just 11 or 12. And it would have affected the Colts' balls too. They were on the same field, playing under the same conditions.

All the evidence points to human intervention. Someone did this. The question is, who? And who gave them their instructions?
comments.subject: Re: Innocent until proven guilty?

comments.article:
Yer a right corker, you are, Grand Ser. Hogans Heroes was my favourite series until I heard that Wild Cards was picked up by SyFy. Already it is my go to show even though it hasn't aired yet. Keep on posting about the NFL because your concise and informative blogs are very educating for a hard working stiff like me. I don't get the opportunity to watch NFL, being so busy, so I need all the help I can to learn about this great sport.

Pats cheated, I just know it.
comments.subject: BWAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA

comments.article:
Not surprisingly the latest is that the league now admits that while they originally said the officials use a pressure gauge that is not always the case and they frequently just feel the ball.

As I expected it's going to come down to the officials messed up but rather than just admit that they have to ry to find a scapegoat first.

I'm an Australian and I don't know a lot about NFL history. Why the huge dislike of Belichick? Was it because he used to work for the Jets? I did see it mentioned that his teams sometimes show no mercy when dominating, which I read was bad form.

That was very amusing to an Aussie as we consider that absolutely thrashing an opponent is all part of the fun :)

1. He's an awesome coach who has won an insane amount
2. He spurned the Jets, who wanted to hire him as head coach when Parcells retired.
3. He is surly and unlikeable with the press.
4. People want to believe his brilliance is due to cheating
5. He was once caught doing something that was illegal (spygate). In truth this thing was legal the season before and he only did it for a game or so before getting caught.
6. Related to #1 they are jealous
7. He does keep the pedal down at times, but this has only ever been in response to something that has been said or done to his team by that teams coach or players. In truth though, its a professional league with grown men. People are just whiny. You won't see him complain about getting thrashed. Just know he will return the favor. The fact that he will be the more likely to be able to return the favor makes people mad.
comments.subject: Reasons they hate him
